perturbation.original_text:
(a) The Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder with respect to the VRRM-MFP Shares by giving 90 days' prior written notice to the Fund and the Calculation and Paying Agent.

(b) The Fund may remove the Remarketing Agent with respect to the VRRM-MFP Shares by giving at least 60 days' prior written notice to the Remarketing Agent (and will provide prior notice also to the Calculation and Paying Agent, if any); provided, however, that no such removal shall become effective for an additional 30 days unless the Fund shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized securities dealer with expertise in remarketing variable rate securities as a successor Remarketing Agent for the VRRM-MFP Shares and the successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a remarketing agreement with the Fund, in form and substance satisfactory to the Fund, in which it shall have agreed to, among other duties, conduct remarketings in respect of VRRM-MFP Shares and determine the Dividend Rate on each Business Day for the VRRM-MFP Shares in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Supplement.
perturbation.changed_text:
(a) The Remarketing Agent may resign and be discharged from its duties and obligations hereunder with respect to the VRRM-MFP Shares by giving 10 days' prior written notice to the Fund and the Calculation and Paying Agent.

(b) The Fund may remove the Remarketing Agent with respect to the VRRM-MFP Shares by giving at least 5 days' prior written notice to the Remarketing Agent (and will provide prior notice also to the Calculation and Paying Agent, if any); provided, however, that no such removal shall become effective for an additional 2 days unless the Fund shall have appointed at least one nationally recognized securities dealer with expertise in remarketing variable rate securities as a successor Remarketing Agent for the VRRM-MFP Shares and the successor Remarketing Agent shall have entered into a remarketing agreement with the Fund, in form and substance satisfactory to the Fund, in which it shall have agreed to, among other duties, conduct remarketings in respect of VRRM-MFP Shares and determine the Dividend Rate on each Business Day for the VRRM-MFP Shares in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Supplement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires 90 days' notice for the Remarketing Agent to resign and 60 days' notice for the Fund to remove the Remarketing Agent. The modified text reduces these notice periods to 10 days and 5 days, respectively. Such short notice periods may not provide adequate time for the Fund or Remarketing Agent to find a suitable replacement, potentially disrupting the remarketing process and harming the interests of the Fund's investors. This can violate general principles of contract law that require reasonable notice for termination to avoid undue hardship or prejudice to either party.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding reasonable notice for termination.

perturbation.original_text: (d) The Fund agrees (i) to deliver to the Remarketing Agent, within fifteen (15) calendar days following the last day of each calendar month beginning with [●], a report of portfolio holdings of the Fund as of the close of business as of the last Business Day of such calendar month, listing portfolio holdings of the Fund by CUSIP and principal amount, and (ii) that, on or after such fifteenth calendar day (or earlier, with the Fund's prior approval) the Remarketing Agent may provide such report and/or the information therein to investors in the VRRM- MFP Shares, upon the investor's request.
perturbation.changed_text: (d) The Fund agrees (i) to deliver to the Remarketing Agent, within thirty (60) calendar days following the last day of each calendar month beginning with [●], a report of portfolio holdings of the Fund as of the close of business as of the last Business Day of such calendar month, listing portfolio holdings of the Fund by CUSIP and principal amount, and (ii) that, on or after such sixtieth calendar day (or earlier, with the Fund's prior approval) the Remarketing Agent may provide such report and/or the information therein to investors in the VRRM- MFP Shares, upon the investor's request.
perturbation.explanation: Increasing the delivery timeframe for the portfolio holdings report to 60 days weakens investor protection by delaying access to vital portfolio information. This delay may hinder their ability to make informed decisions and assess the Fund's risk profile accurately, contradicting regulatory emphasis on transparency and timely information dissemination for investors.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations emphasizing timely information dissemination to investors.

perturbation.original_text: The Remarketing Agent may, in its sole discretion, modify the settlement procedures set forth therein with respect to any Remarketing upon ten (10) days' prior written notice to the Fund and the Calculation and Paying Agent, provided any such modification does not adversely affect the Holders, the Beneficial Owners, the Calculation and Paying Agent or the Fund.
perturbation.changed_text: The Remarketing Agent may, in its sole discretion, modify the settlement procedures set forth therein with respect to any Remarketing immediately with no notice to the Fund and the Calculation and Paying Agent.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the notice requirement for modifications to settlement procedures allows the Remarketing Agent to make changes without informing the Fund, Calculation and Paying Agent and potentially harming the Holders and Beneficial Owners, and adversely affect the Holders, the Beneficial Owners, the Calculation and Paying Agent or the Fund.
perturbation.contradicted_law: SEC regulations emphasizing timely information dissemination to investors.
